titleStmt.title: Great and glorious news from Ireland being a full and particular account of a most terrible and bloody fight which was on Wednesday last, June 2d between the Royal Army commanded by His Majesty King William, and the whole French and Irish Army commanded by the late King James ... : with the killing of the Dukes of Berwick, and Tyrconnel, and six thousand more of the enemy on the spot, and the taking of seven thousand prisoners : with the manner of King William' taking the city of Dublin.

Great and glorious news from Ireland being a full and particular account of a most terrible and bloody fight which was on Wednesday last, June 2d between the Royal Army commanded by His Majesty King William, and the whole French and Irish Army commanded by the late King James ... : with the killing of the Dukes of Berwick, and Tyrconnel, and six thousand more of the enemy on the spot, and the taking of seven thousand prisoners : with the manner of King William' taking the city of Dublin.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
